SPSI Jabar Dorong Pemerintah Naikkan UMK 2020 Sampai 20 Persen
04 Nov 2019, 09:06 by Ai Rika Rachmawati
BANDUNG, (PR).- Serikat Pekerja Seluruh Indonesia (SPSI) Jawa Barat (Jabar) meminta agar pemerintah menetapkan kenaikan upah minimum kabupaten/kota (UMK) 2020 sebesar 15%-20%. Angka tersebut sesuai dengan perhitungan kebutuhan hidup layak (KHL).
Demikian diungkapkan Ketua SPSI Jabar, Roy Jinto, di Bandung, Senin, 4 November 2019. Menurut dia, berdasarkan perhitungan SPSI Jabar, KHL 2020 naik sekitar 15%-20% dibandingkan tahun lalu.
"Kami akan menggelar aksi untuk mendesak pemerintah menetapkan kenaikan UMK sebesar 15%-20%," ujarnya.
Rencananya, menurut dia, aksi tersebut akan digelar sebelum penetapan UMK di Jabar. UMK 27 kabupaten/kota di Jabar akan ditetapkan pada 21 November mendatang.
"Selain terkait UMK, aksi ini juga akan kami gelar dengan agenda untuk meminta gubernur mencabut UMP (upah minimum provinsi)," katanya.
Sementara untuk UMK, berdasarkan catatan "PR" pada 2019 UMK tertinggi di Jabar ditempati Kabupaten Karawang, sebesar Rp4.234.010,27. Untuk yang terendah ditempati Kota Banjar sebesar Rp1.688.217,52.Â 
Ridwan Kamil agar mencabut UMP Jabar 2020
Mereka juga meminta agar Gubernur Jabar segera mencabut UMP Jabar 2020, yang baru ditetapkan pada 1 November 2019. Seperti diketahui, UMP Jabar sudah ditetapkan pada 1 November lalu sebesar Rp 1,8 juta.
Roy Jinto, mengatakan, penolakan SPSI karena dua faktor. Yang pertama, menurut dia, Jabar tidak membutuhkan UMP. Kedua karena UMP yang sudah ditetapkan tidak memperhitungkan kebutuhan hidup layak (KHL).
"Setiap kabupaten/kota di Jabar sudah memiliki upah minimum kabupaten/kota atau UMK yang akan ditetapkan pada 21 November mendatang," ujarnya.
Setiap tahunnya, menurut Roy, 27 kabupaten/kota di Jabar memberlakukan upah minimum sesuai dengan UMK masing-masing, bukan UMP. Dengan demikian, ia menilai, Jabar tidak membutuhkan UMP.
"Keberadaan UMP justru akan membuat aturan pengupahan menjadi tumpang tindih," katanya.
Jabar, menurut dia, berbeda dengan DKI Jakarta yang harus menetapkan UMP untuk diberlakukan di seluruh provinsi tersebut. Jakarta tidak memiliki UMK seperti Jabar.
Lagi pula, menurut dia, sesuai Undang-undang No. 13 tahun 2003 tentang Ketenagakerjaan, upah minimum berdasarkan pada UMP atau UMK. Jadi, menurut dia, Gubernur hanya perlu memilih salah satunya.
Sementara terkait KHL, menurut Roy, dalam UU Ketenagakerjaan pasal 88 dan 89 disebutkan bahwa perhitungan KHL harus disertakan dalam penentuan upah minimum.
Dengan tidak disertakannya KHL dalam penentuan UMP 2020, menurut dia, berarti Gubernur sudah melanggar UU.
"Dalam menentukan UMP, Gubernur hanya mempertinbangkan laju pertumbuhan ekonomi dan inflasi. Gubernur hanya mengacu pada Peraturan Pemerintah No. 78 tahun 2015 tentang Pengupahan," kata Roy.
Jika mengacu pada UU Ketenagakerjaan, menurut dia, seharusnya UMP Jabar bukan Rp 1,8 juta, tapi Rp 2,5 juta. Pasalnya, menurut dia, berdasarkan perhitungan KHL di Kota Banjar sebagai daerah dengan upah minimun terendah di Jabar, seharusnya KHL tahun ini naik 15%-20%.
"Saya bisa memastikan bahwa UMP 2020 ditetapkan tanpa memperhitungkan KHL karena kami Serikat Pekerja di Dewan Pengupahan Jabar tidak pernah diajak pemerintah untuk melakukan perhitungan KHL," tuturnya.***

West Java SPSI Encourages the Government to Raise UMK 2020 to 20 Percent
Nov 04 2019, 09:06 by Ai Rika Rachmawati
BANDUNG, (PR) .- The All-Indonesia Workers Union (SPSI) of West Java (West Java) requested that the government set a 2020 / city minimum wage increase of 15% -20%. This figure is in accordance with the calculation of decent living needs (KHL).
This was stated by the Chairman of the West Java SPSI, Roy Jinto, in Bandung, Monday, November 4, 2019. According to him, based on the West Java SPSI calculation, KHL 2020 rose around 15% -20% compared to last year.
"We will hold actions to urge the government to set the UMK increase of 15-20 percent," he said.
The plan, according to him, the action will be held before the establishment of MSEs in West Java. UMK 27 districts / cities in West Java will be set on 21 November.
"In addition to related to UMK, we will also hold this action with an agenda to ask the governor to revoke the UMP (provincial minimum wage)," he said.
While for MSEs, based on the record "PR" in 2019 the highest MSEs in West Java are occupied by Karawang Regency, amounting to Rp4,234,010.27. For the lowest occupied by the City of Banjar amounting to Rp1,688,217.52.
Ridwan Kamil to revoke West Java UMP 2020
They also requested that the West Java Governor immediately revoke the West Java 2020 UMP, which was only set on November 1, 2019. As is known, the West Java UMP was set on November 1, amounting to Rp 1.8 million.
Roy Jinto, said that SPSI's rejection was due to two factors. The first, according to him, West Java does not need a UMP. Second, because the UMP has not been determined to take into account the needs of a decent living (KHL).
"Every regency / city in West Java already has a regency / city minimum wage or UMK which will be set on November 21st," he said.
Every year, according to Roy, 27 regencies / cities in West Java impose minimum wages in accordance with their respective MSEs, not UMP. Thus, he considered, West Java does not need a UMP.
"The existence of the UMP will actually make wage regulations overlap," he said.
West Java, according to him, is different from DKI Jakarta, which must establish a UMP to be enforced in all of these provinces. Jakarta does not have MSEs like West Java.
Besides, according to him, according to Law No. 13 of 2003 concerning Manpower, the minimum wage is based on the UMP or MSE. So, according to him, the Governor only needs to choose one of them.
While related to KHL, according to Roy, the Labor Law articles 88 and 89 mentioned that the calculation of KHL must be included in determining the minimum wage.
By not including KHL in determining the 2020 UMP, according to him, it means that the Governor has violated the law.
"In determining the UMP, the Governor only considers the rate of economic growth and inflation. The Governor only refers to Government Regulation No. 78 of 2015 concerning Wages," Roy said.
If referring to the Manpower Act, according to him, the West Java UMP should not be Rp. 1.8 million, but Rp. 2.5 million. The reason, according to him, based on the calculation of KHL in the City of Banjar as an area with the lowest minimum wage in West Java, this year KHL should rise by 15% -20%.
"I can confirm that the 2020 UMP is determined without taking into account the KHL because we the Workers Union in the West Java Wage Council has never been invited by the government to do KHL calculations," he said. ***
